value.title: Progress, not peace: Breaking down the Trump-brokered deals between Israel, Arab states
value.excerpt: As dignitaries gathered on the White House's South Lawn on Tuesday to witness historic U.S.-brokered deals between Israel and two Gulf Arab states, the situation thousands of miles away on Israel's doorstep was less serene.

value.title: Rumors of an Iranian assassination plot offer lessons that Trump can't seem to learn
value.excerpt: Opinion: The US should trade threats and threat-inflation for deterrence and, eventually, effective diplomacy.

value.title: 2020 Election Live Updates: Biden and Trump Gear Up for the Debates
value.excerpt: Joe Biden took questions from voters at a town hall event near his hometown of Scranton, Pa., and President Trump held an airport rally in Wisconsin.

value.title: The Health 202: Trump keeps claiming he lowered prescription drug prices. But that is largely not true
value.excerpt: President Trump clearly wants Americans to believe he has axed the nation’s costly drug prices, as Election Day nears. Support our journalism. Subscribe today. Over the past two months, the president has tweeted 18 times that he has lowered — or will lower — the cost of prescription drugs.

value.title: If the Justice Department intervenes for Trump in defamation lawsuit, the case would ‘end’
value.excerpt: Constitutional law expert Leah Litman explains the latest twist in E. Jean Carroll’s lawsuit against the president.

value.title: Watchdog group calls on FEC to investigate donations to Trump and others by relatives and associates of Louis DeJoy
value.excerpt: In a new complaint to the Federal Election Commission, the nonprofit Campaign Legal Center said a pattern of contributions made by the family and employees of the postmaster general as recently as 2018 merits scrutiny.

value.title: Amy Dorris' Trump sexual assault allegation deserves America's full attention
value.excerpt: While we cannot force Republicans (or Democrats) to call the president on his hypocrisy, we can force ourselves not to become numb to the accusations against him.

value.title: ‘It’s a really weird dynamic’: Breaking down Trump’s reelection map
value.excerpt: The president’s high floor of support is keeping him within range of Joe Biden in a number of states. Yet his ceiling is so low that it threatens his hold in a number of others that he should have locked down by now.

value.title: As Trump clashes with CDC, the media accuse him of ignoring science
value.excerpt: The latest media uproar over Trump--there seems to be at least one a day--was triggered by the way he contradicted the head of the CDC.

value.title: Trump and Biden hit unlikely battleground state of Minnesota
value.excerpt: Donald Trump almost won Minnesota in 2016 and sees it as a state he can peel away from Democrat Joe Biden in November

value.title: At town hall, Biden blasts Trump's 'criminal' virus response
value.excerpt: Joe Biden is deriding President Donald Trump for his handling of COVID-19, calling his downplaying of the pandemic “criminal” and his administration “totally irresponsible.”

value.title: Gulf Between Trump and Doctors on Mask Wearing Gets Wider
value.excerpt: The gulf between President Donald Trump and public health experts over wearing face masks keeps getting wider.

value.title: Trump goes after Black Lives Matter, ‘toxic propaganda’ in schools
value.excerpt: Speaking from the National Archives, the president positioned himself as a defender of American exceptionalism against activists trying to destroy the country’s sense of self.

value.title: Trump seeks to energize rural voters key to 2016 success in Wisconsin campaign rally
value.excerpt: Kicking off three days of campaigning, Trump will speak to supporters at an airport in Mosinee, Wisconsin, a state he won by less than 1 point in 2016.

value.title: Woman accuses Donald Trump of sexually assaulting her at 1997 US Open
value.excerpt: A woman has accused President Donald Trump of sexually assaulting her at the 1997 U.S. Open in New York. In an exclusive interview with The Guardian, Amy Dorris said Mr. Trump groped various parts of her body and forced his tongue into her mouth outside a bathroom at the event.

value.title: Trump: "Jeb Is Extraordinarily Energetic Compared To Sleepy Joe"
value.excerpt: I got the Big 10 [back], no other president would have gotten involved with that. Can you imagine Biden doing it? He is a low-energy person. I used to call Jeb Bush ‘low energy.’ Jeb is extraordinarily energetic compared to Sleepy Joe.

value.title: Biden promises Russia will 'pay a price' for election meddling while Trump rails against his own FBI director
value.excerpt: Trump attacked FBI Director Christopher Wray for testifying on Thursday that Russia is interfering in the 2020 election to undermine Biden.

value.title: Ex-Pence aide blasts Trump over Covid response, says she’ll vote for Biden
value.excerpt: It was shocking to see the president saying that the virus was a hoax,” said Olivia Troye, a Republican adviser on the coronavirus task force.

value.title: Replay: Trump Holds "Great American Comeback" Rally In Mosinee, Wisconsin
value.excerpt: President Trump delivered remarks at a 'Great American Comeback' event in Mosinee, WI on Thursday night. At his Mosinee, WI rally, Trump references Biden's town hall on CNN: "I see he's up there tonight getting softball questions from Anderson cooper.

value.title: Baldwin, Evers: Funding promised by Trump to help Kenosha can't be used to rebuild
value.excerpt: U.S. Sen. Tammy Baldwin and Gov. Tony Evers say money promised for Kenosha's recovery by the Trump administration could amount to much less than expected.

value.title: Trump doesn't want ByteDance to maintain control of TikTok - official
value.excerpt: U.S. President Donald Trump does not want China's ByteDance to maintain a controlling interest in TikTok because it could put Americans' personal information at risk, a senior administration official speaking on condition of anonymity said on Thursday.

value.title: Cash-strapped Trump campaign awaits a bailout from big donors
value.excerpt: Preserve America, a new super PAC backing the president, is planning another $25 million ad blitz attacking Joe Biden.

value.title: Pence's former top aide says Trump called coronavirus 'a good thing' because he didn't like shaking hands with 'disgusting' supporters
value.excerpt: Olivia Troye said Trump was primarily concerned with the economy and his reelection and undermined the task force's pandemic response.

value.title: Fact check: Fake article from 2015 quoting Donald Trump resurfaces
value.excerpt: The article reports Trump the candidate was in Indianapolis and disparaged African Americans at an event. The claim is false; that never happened.

value.title: Trump plans panel to promote 'patriotic education' in appeal to conservative base
value.excerpt: President Donald Trump said on Thursday he planned to establish a commission to promote "patriotic education" in the United States, taking issue with efforts to highlight the United States' history of slavery and racism.

value.title: Trump Might Win N.C., But That Doesn't Mean Tillis Will
value.excerpt: North Carolina is a state to watch not just for the presidential race, but for which party will control the United States Senate. Recent polling conducted on the race between Donald Trump and

value.title: Businesses reject Trump payroll tax plan while postponing their own tax bills
value.excerpt: Most American workers won’t be getting the payroll tax break pushed by President Donald Trump, thanks to widespread opposition from employers. But many businesses are using a similar break to punt their own payroll tax bills. Tens of thousands of ...

value.title: Top Trump health appointee Michael Caputo warns of armed insurrection after election
value.excerpt: The assistant secretary for public affairs at the Department of Health and Human Services promoted conspiracy theories in a Facebook Live event.

value.title: Newsom gently confronts Trump on climate, but others in his administration aren't so gentle
value.excerpt: The California governor dropped his fiery tone on climate change as he engaged Trump in a respectful conversation in which both men lauded their relationship..

value.title: 'It'll start getting cooler, you just watch': Trump denies scientific consensus that climate change is supercharging the West's wildfires
value.excerpt: The president dismissed that the wildfires in California and Oregon were related to climate change: "I don't think science knows, actually."
